intro: Ortholoma minor, commonly known as the small ortholoma, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its small, clustered white flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has finely divided, fern-like leaves. It is often found in open woodlands and grasslands, thriving in well-drained soils. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
